alert.note: Alert for Ashe; Watauga; Wilkes (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 7:18PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by earlier heavy rainfall this afternoon and evening. * WHERE...A portion of northwest North Carolina, including the following counties, Ashe, Watauga and Wilkes. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some small creeks and streams may experience flooding for several hours this evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 715 PM EDT, Earlier this afternoon and evening, from 2 to 3 inches of rain fell across parts of the advisory area. This heavy rainfall has resulted in excessive runoff into area creeks and streams. Low-lying and normally flood prone areas will be subject to minor flooding this evening. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Beech Creek, Cane Creek, Camp Branch, Clear Branch, Brushy Fork, Beaverdam Creek, Basin Creek, Big Sandy Creek, Church Branch, Cove Creek, Bee Tree Branch and Big Bugaboo Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Boone... North Wilkesboro... Blowing Rock... Beech Mountain... Deep Gap... Wilbar... Mc Grady... - For additional information on creek, stream, and river levels please go to our web page located at: http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Precautionary Statements: When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
